EOYS.desc:
The Cooper Union School of Architecture hosts their student End of Year show at the Foundation Building, 41 Cooper Sq which would be free and open to the public. However, due to the effects of Covid19, they pivoted towards a fully digital experince in the form of a virtual exhibition. I worked on designing and developing the site while students and faculty rendered the final 3D spaces using Unreal Engine. Thanks to the hard work of everyone involved, we were able to successfully launch all 8 floors of projects within the tight timeline of 2 weeks. The opening Zoom ceremony was met with great positivity, bringing together a community that had been scattered and isolated since the beginning of lockdown.


Visit Site

Input.desc:
These 2 sister media sites from Bustle Media Group, Input and Inverse, can only be described as “organized chaos,” carrying tons of energy and exuding maximalism. Worked on the design system, that would combine a mixture of layouts, textures, and colors for maximum flexibility for their content editors.


Visit InputVisit Inverse

THEREMIX.desc:
THEREMIX is a progressive web app that brings the interaction of a physical theremin into the virtual space. The virtual theremin can be controlled either with mouse/touch inputs or with gestures through a webcam via human pose tracking provided by PoseNet. This app celebrates the 100th anniversary of the theremin, invented by Léon Theremin in 1920. A century after its conception, the theremin continues to be a flexible electronic instrument with an ethereal tone.

Site of the Day and Dev Award from Awwwards, The FWA, CSS Design Awards, and featured on Muzli.

It is also currently nominated for best music website at the Webby Awards! The app has seen 48,000 visitors since its launch!


Visit Theremix!

img.caption: Homepage

Whirly.desc:
Designed and developed a playful promotional landing page for Ursa Minor Type Foundry's new variable font, Whirly Birdie.


Visit Whirly Birdie

cavtah.desc:
I was approached by Benjamin Binstock who needed a website to showcase his new project: Center for Advancement of Visual Technologies in Art History. Primarily a Rembrandt historian, he has made it his life's work to challenging the ideas of the institution on "What is a Rembrandt?" and is devoted to the idea that different ways of visualizing Rembrandt's ouvre is crucial in pinpointing which paintings are by Rembrandt and which are falsely attributed to him.

For this first stage of work, I created a website that would feature Binstock's mission statement as its main content with clickable links to images referenced. Some images also have SVG illustrations that animate when loaded. This visual flair will allude to how image annotations in a more analytical article would be styled. Binstock is also able to add footnotes and annotations in the case that his statement needs revision. I also created a custom Google Doc CMS that updates the main website using combination of highlighting, footnotes, and document comments that push to a Firebase database. The Google Doc was made to mirror the design of the website to give him a more accurate visuals of what his copy may look like.



Visit Site

distributor.desc:
A lightweight plugin for Figma that spaces elements evenly by exact pixel measurements without needing to make unnecessary groups. Unfortunately, this doesn't seem to be a feature that Figma supports natively.

You can space items vertically or horizontally from their edges or their centers. Alignment options also let you choose which side the items are distributed towards. Elements are repositioned based on their bounding boxes, so the plugin works on rotated objects as well.



View Plugin

img.caption: Plugin demo
img.text:

fjp.desc:
Facebook Journalism Project was started two years ago as an outreach and investment tool to help journalists and publishers be more successful on Facebook’s platform through events, trainings, case studies and initiatives.

To help journalists be more successful on the Facebook platform, the site and content strategy was focused on providing a highly visual storytelling experience. As part of Code and Theory’s visual team, I helped establish the global design system and fleshed out the components in this modular and flexible site. We kept much of the brand visuals as background patterns and maintained their specific blue motif. To maintain image and video content as the main focus of the site, much of the layouts are resolved with large sweeping imagery along with occasional parallax interactions.


Visit Site

img.caption: Homepage
img.text:

ids.desc:
Founded in 1997, The Cooper Union Intra-Disciplinary Seminar is a public lecture series that invites artists, theorists, activists, designers, writers, curators, and more to discuss their practice. With my partners at the co-founded creative agency Polyphony, we created a logo, website, and motion graphics, along with a visual identity for the Fall 2017 and Spring 2018 series. The branding work for the Cooper Union Intra-Disciplinary Seminar was featured on Fonts in Use as a staff pick.


ids.cooper.edu

img.caption: Logo animation

The branding work for the Cooper Union Intra-Disciplinary Seminar was featured on Fonts in Use as a staff pick.

kalidoface.desc:
Become a virtual character with just your webcam!

Kalidoface is a progressive web app perfect for livestreaming, chatting with friends, or just having fun animating your expressions in real time! The app works with Live2D rigged characters from Cubism 2.0 and 4.0 files. Upload your own .zip for a truly custom experience.

Kalidoface also supports one-on-one calling with friends over WebRTC. Enter your friend's unique ID and start chatting using expressive avatars when you're not in the mood for regular video.


Visit Kalidoface!


All Live2D models are redistributed under Live2D's Free Material License.

img.caption: Kalidoface animates characters with real time face and iris tracking
img.tags: Web,App, Face Tracking, Tensorflow, WebGL, WebRTC, Svelte

Kalidoface also supports one-on-one calling with friends over WebRTC. Enter your friend's unique ID and start chatting using expressive avatars when you're not in the mood for regular video.

magicblue.desc:
This is a small project aimed at reverse engineering a generic Bluetooth lightbulb and controlling it directly through the browser without the official companion app. As of writing this, Web Bluetooth is only supported in Chrome. For the magicblue.js library, I was able to reconstruct all the Bluetooth protocols for the RGBW functions, strobe functions, and schedule functions and bring them into the Web Bluetooth ecosystem.

For the demo site, I went for a playful circular UI with interspersed micro-interactions. I also added other superfluous functions such as voice commands and data analytics.


Demo


Github

moonlints.desc:
A birthday gift for a friend who designs type.

You play as a snowy owl that has to defend its home from dangerous typographic (inside jokes) threats! When connected to bluetooth lights via Magicblue.js, your lights will turn an ambient red when you are damaged in-game. A very fast project made just in time for the party.



Play the game!

Play the game!

rocco.desc: During my internship at Piscatello Design Centre, I designed, and developed a website for Rocco Piscatello’s award winning poster series, “Posterworks for FIT”, to promote the release of his book. The site archives all his posters from 2003-2014, all of which are purchasable directly on the site with a custom ecommerce interface. The site was featured on Site Inspire. Unfortunately, the site is no longer up.

img.caption: Mobile pages: Home (Posters), Reflection, Shop
img.text: During my internship at Piscatello Design Centre, I designed, and developed a website for Rocco Piscatello’s award winning poster series, “Posterworks for FIT”, to promote the release of his book. The site archives all his posters from 2003-2014, all of which are purchasable directly on the site with a custom ecommerce interface. The site was featured on Site Inspire. Unfortunately, the site is no longer up.

touchtype.desc:
An interactive type experiment that uses simple body tracking provided by Posenet and the Reynolds Flocking algorithm example by the Coding Train to simulate flocking particle motions.

Use your hands to distort the type. Walk away from the camera and watch the type disappear.

Although originally made as a projection installation for a friend's birthday, I'm happy that I was able to present this piece at the Today Art Museum, Beijing and Typographics, Cooper Union.


Featured on Google Experiments

img.caption: Interacting with Type
img.text:
An interactive type experiment that uses simple body tracking provided by Posenet and the Reynolds Flocking algorithm example by the Coding Train to simulate flocking particle motions.

Although originally made as a projection installation for a friend's birthday, I'm happy that I was able to present this piece at the Today Art Museum, Beijing and Typographics, Cooper Union.

Here There Exhibition at Today Art Museum, Beijing

typographics.desc:
Typographics is a yearly type festival hosted and organized at the Cooper Union. I worked on the branding team of this year’s redesign. The 2018 identity is based around the moiré pattern phenomenon and thus our exploration has concentrated on optical illusions. The design team and I worked to create the wordmark for the event and expanded the scope of the identity to video sequences, wall graphics, web and social media ads, and merchandise. Below are HTML web ads using lenticular animation and the animated hero background for the website.


2018.typographics.com

img.caption: Hero animation for website
img.text:

vrbrowser.desc:
VR-Browser is a web browser that transforms websites and search terms into VR-ready 3D environments. Users who land on the same website will be able to interact and talk with one another. This experiment is inspired by World Wide Maze and the ever popular VR Chat. If there isn't anyone on the server, you can open up 2 tabs view multiplayer.

In addition to its VR components, AR mode gives a real-time view of all users on a particular website or search term. Unfortunately, the platform doesn't support markerless AR at the moment. To use AR with this project, please print out or save a Hiro Marker and point your camera at it.

Special Thanks
Erin Sparling
Hayden Lee—Networked Aframe
Jerome Etienne—AR.js
Node Webshot

You can find the source code for this project here as well as the custom screenshotting API here.


vr-browser.herokuapp.com

img.caption: Visiting various websites and Google searches as a single user.
iPad view of multiplayer interaction when loading the same webpage, "google.com."
img.text:
VR-Browser is a web browser that transforms websites and search terms into VR-ready 3D environments. Users who land on the same website will be able to interact and talk with one another. This experiment is inspired by World Wide Maze and the ever popular VR Chat. If there isn't anyone on the server, you can open up 2 tabs view multiplayer.

In addition to its VR components, AR mode gives a real-time view of all users on a particular website or search term. Unfortunately, the platform doesn't support markerless AR at the moment. To use AR with this project, please print out or save a Hiro Marker and point your camera at it.

yearbook.desc: The Cable is the Cooper Union yearbook, named after Peter Cooper's important role in creating the Transatlantic Cable. With my partners at Polyphony, we designed our 'Class of 2018' yearbook. Our idea was to pair each student with an object they would bring in that represented themselves—a kind of self portrait. We would then isolate and colorize each object and pattern the object for each student spread. In order to recognize our year as the first graduating class to stray from Cooper Union's mission of free education, we also wanted to make sure that the costs that went into the yearbook remained transparent. We totalled the costs for photography, design and printing, and also added the estimated value of all the objects brought.

In order to recognize our year as the first graduating class to stray from Cooper Union's mission of free education, we also wanted to make sure that the costs that went into the yearbook remained transparent. We totalled the costs for photography, design and printing, and also added the estimated value of all the objects brought.
